place.name: FARLESTHORPE
place.gazetteerText: FARLSTHORPE, a parish in Spilsby district, Lincoln; on the East Lincoln railway, 2 miles SE of Alford. Post town, Alford. Acres, 1, 043. Real property, £1, 568. Pop., 135. Houses, 26. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £64. Patron, Mrs. J. Kipling. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
